name: NTLM Brute Force
description: Detects common NTLM brute force device names
false_positives: Systems with names equal to the spoofed ones used by the brute force tools
query: (winlog.channel:Microsoft\-Windows\-NTLM\/Operational AND event.code:8004 AND source.domain:(/[Rr][Dd][Ee][Ss][Kk][Tt][Oo][Pp]/ OR /[Rr][Ee][Mm][Mm][Ii][Nn][Aa]/ OR /[Ff][Rr][Ee][Ee][Rr][Dd][Pp]/ OR /[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]7/ OR /[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]8/ OR /[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]2012/ OR /[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]2016/ OR /[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]2019/))
note: **Detection Rule without Regex for better understanding. Be careful, this way is case sensitive:**`(winlog.channel:Microsoft\-Windows\-NTLM\/Operational AND event.code:8004 AND source.domain:(Rdesktop OR Remmina OR Freerdp OR Windows7 OR Windows8 OR Windows2012 OR Windows2016 OR Windows2019))`
